page.title: 14THE RIVER CHERWELL,TWYFORD.
page.content: MAINTENANCE WORK HAS BEEN TRIMMING AND DREDGING.INSPECTIONS TAKE PLACE AND WHEN RESOURCES PERMIT ROUTINE WORK IS CARRIED OUT.A REQUEST FROM THE RIPARIAN OWNER CAN BE MADE,AND TRIMMING,DREDGING OR TREE REMOVAL IS CARRIED OUT AFTER CONSULTATION WITH LOCAL CONSERVATION, NATURALIST AND FISHING INTERESTS.RECORD SHOWS THAT SINCE 1966 MORE Â£SUMMER' FLOWS EXCEEDING BANKFULL CONDITION HAVE BEEN EXPERIENCED SINCE 1977 THAN BEFORE.FISHING ALONG THIS STRETCH IS Â£OWNED'BY A CLUB.THE ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES INFORMED THAMES WATER THAT TWO RECENT POLLUTION INCIDENTS IN BANBURY HAVE DEPLETED THE FISH STOCK.THE RIVER RECOVERY IS LOOKED UPON BEING LONG TERM AS THE GENERAL QUALITY OF RIVER WATER AFTER BANBURY IS IN NEED OF IMPROVEMENT.THAMES WATER ARE TO REBUILD BANBURY SEWAGE WORKS TO MEET RIVER QUALITY OBJECTIVES.(EST COST $4.5 M)
